alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:10PM CST until March 04 at 12:30PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River at Poplar Bluff. .Runoff from recent heavy rain will force the Black River at Poplar Bluff above flood stage for a brief period of time tonight and Saturday morning. For the Black River...including Poplar Bluff...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Poplar Bluff. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. If the water continues to rise, Hillcrest Park will be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Friday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 16.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. T
